results.title: Nicholas and Alexandra
results.creator_credit: Franklin J. Schaffner, Sam Spiegel, Columbia, Horizon (GB) and Horizon (US)
results.brief_description: A dazzling cast, with Michael Jayston and Janet Suzman playing the lead roles of the ill-fated Czar Nicholas II, and the Czarina Alexandra. Born to be one of the world’s most powerful men, Nicholas ruled millions of people with an empire stretching over one-sixth of the globe. His belief in the Divine Right to rule, made him oblivious to the hardships endured by many of his subjects who were ready to embrace the powerful ideals proposed by Lenin and his followers. The Czarina, in a desperate bid to find a cure for their haemophiliac son, relies heavily on the seductive and mysterious “Mad Monk” Rasputin. Once Lenin and his Bolsheviks gain power, the Royal Family is doomed. “Nicholas and Alexandra” is filled with the pomp and pageantry of history’s great events.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Franklin J. Schaffner, Sam Spiegel, Columbia, Horizon (GB) and Horizon (US)

results.title: The Miracle worker
results.creator_credit: Arthur Penn, Fred Coe and Playfilm Productions
results.brief_description: Ann Bancroft and Patty Duke reprised their stage roles and won Academy Awards for their performances in “The Miracle worker.” Blind and deaf from an early childhood illness, Helen Keller lived in a world of solitude where animal instinct and a strong will enabled her to survive the dangers of everyday life. Annie Sullivan, a poor partially blind Irish girl, comes to the Keller mansion to teach Helen. She also has indomitable courage and strength but must struggle not only with Helen’s enormous will, but against a family whose love and pity for their child is so great, it keeps her locked in a prison of darkness and ignorance. A moving film with outstanding performances. Based on the play by William Gibson and the lives of two incredible women.

results.title: Far from the madding crowd
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Joseph Janni, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Vic Films
results.brief_description: This adaptation of Thomas Hardy’s classic novel is also a classic of English cinema. The beautiful Bathsheba (Julie Christie) is determined to consolidate her class position and refuses to accept a poor but devoted herdsman (Alan Bates) as her husband. Using her beauty and charm, she attracts the attention of a rich suitor (Peter Finch), but it is a frivolous womanising soldier (Terence Stamp) who wins her heart. This results in a disastrous marriage which threatens to destroy her fortunes. Schlesinger’s confident direction is beautifully complimented by Nicholas Roeg’s luscious cinematography which highlights the wild, stark grandeur of the south English coast, a perfect visual equivalent to Hardy’s expressive naturalist prose. This film is a passionate love story and a powerful investigation into the emotional treachery of the English class system.

results.title: Total recall
results.creator_credit: Paul Verhoeven, Buzz Feitshans, Ronald Shusett, Carrolco and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in the year 2084, “Total Recall” tells the story of Doug Quaid who after having strange dream about Mars, visits a travel service called Rekall Inc. which implants artificial vacation memories into their clients’ brains. In Quaid’s case, the process goes horribly wrong and he discovers that his life on earth is an illusion, and that his real persona once lived on Mars. The film follows Quaid’s search for his identity and the unravelling of the mystery which surrounds his life. Starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sharon Stone, Ronny Cox, this film has exceptional special effects, and is based on a story by renowned science fiction writer Phillip K. Dick.

results.title: They live
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, Larry Franco and Alive Films
results.brief_description: Based on Ray Nelson’s short story “Eight o’clock in the morning”, this is a fantastically subversive film which uses the clever premise that those in control of the global economic power structure are other-worldly aliens. Masquerading as humans they are overpowering the Earth and its inhabitants with an hypnotic form of mind control - hidden subliminal messages in the mass media. Featuring state-of-the-art special effects and starring Roddy Piper, Keith David and Meg Foster, this fast-paced adventure hurtles the viewer into another dimension where all is not as it seems.

results.title: Rambo III
results.creator_credit: Peter MacDonald, Buzz Feitshans and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Considered by many critics to be the best of the three films in the Rambo: ‘First Blood trilogy.’ The film’s plot takes on a righteous turn as the “universal soldier” Rambo seeks to liberate a group of Afghans from under the regime of a brutal Russian General. The action sequences in this film are both spectacular and terrifying, and the enigmatic, not altogether two dimensional character of Rambo rises above the conflagration with more style than in the previous films.

results.title: Rambo: first blood. Part II
results.creator_credit: George Pan Cosmatos, Buzz Feitshans and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Rambo is sent on a secret mission to help the U.S. Government find remaining Prisoners of War in Vietnam. However, although the mission is designed to fail, the bureaucrats did not take into account Rambo’s fierce determination, courage and skill to bring them back - alone if necessary. Rambo is launched into the jungle and the film explodes into one fireball action sequence after another.

results.title: Eureka
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Jeremy Thomas, J F Productions and Recorded Picture Company
results.brief_description: This is the dramatic story of the anticlimactic life of a greedy gold prospector after he has struck it rich. Gene Hackman performs with credit as a man whose jackpot fortune leaves him bored, surly and paranoid of being exploited by everybody, including his family. Jane Lapotaire plays his alcoholic wife and Theresa Russell his woman-daughter who rebelliously marries a man her father sees only as a merciless fortune hunter. This is an unforgettable tale of the illusory nature of power and the all-consuming violence of possession - whether it be of love or gold. Based on a book by Marshall Houts.

results.title: Only when I laugh
results.creator_credit: Glenn Jordan, Neil Simon, Roger M Rothstein and Colubia Pictures Industries
results.brief_description: A bittersweet Neil Simon comedy about alcoholic Broadway actress, Georgia Hines’ (Marsha Mason), struggle to remain sober and who six years earlier relinquished custody of her daughter Polly (Kristy McNichol) in order to “straighten out her life.” Georgia is about to star in a play about her turbulent romantic past, when Polly decides to move in. There are good times, pretending to be sisters to confuse a pair of college boys, and there are tough times, when they confront the past and the truth about the lost years. Through it all, with humour and warmth, they come to know one another again. Superior performances by James Coco as a gay failed actor, Joan Hackett as an aging Park Avenue beauty, Georgia’s “perennially out-of-work” friends, and David Dukes as boyfriend David. Screenplay by Neil Simon, loosley based on his play “The Gingerbread Lady.”

results.title: Much ado about nothing
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Branagh, David Parfitt, Stephen Evans, Renaissance Films and Samuel Goldwyn
results.brief_description: Once again Branagh has successfully brought Shakespeare to modern audiences in a way which will inspire and enthuse even those unfamiliar with the plays. “Much ado about nothing” is a romantic comedy which is full of energy, largely due to its inspired casting. The idyllic Italian countryside is the setting for the story of Hero and Claudio, a young couple whose impending marriage is thrown into jeopardy when Claudio is deceived by his brother Don John. Kenneth Branagh, Emma Thompson, Robert Sean Leonard, Denzel Washington, Keanu Reeves, Kate Beckinsale, Brian Blessed and Richard Briers star in this delightful adaptation while Michael Keaton and Ben Elton in cameos, steal the film with their brilliant comic caricatures.
